p: Also on 11 February, the Cairo office was informed by their China office colleagues that all exposed employees should be tested for SARS-CoV-2. Mr D, Ms A and about 22 other employees received complete blood counts, chest X-rays and nasal and throat swabs for SARS-CoV-2 testing at the Egyptian Ministry of Health, which then had the capacity to do the testing. Mr D (the Chinese manager who shared the same house as the two afflicted managers who had returned to China, Ms B and Mr C) tested positive (Figure 1). Mr D was completely asymptomatic and is the first documented COVID-19 case in Egypt. As of March, Ms A has remained uninfected and asymptomatic.
